column4: when i try to install one of these packages i get the message, "Depends: liblame0 (>=3.96.1-1) but it is not installable" how do i go around that?
enable multiverse
i've enabled everything in synaptic
any other idea's these are just the multimedia plugins
yeah, liblame0 is in multiverse
have you run apt-get update?
you need to run that after making changes to sources.list
so everytime i install i package i have to run apt-get update?
how do i do this
, if you want to get changes, you need to run apt-get update, that updates the local database of available packages, apt-get upgrade committs any upgrades that are available
so this is done in the terminal right, not in synaptic
well apt-get update is the same as the reload button in synaptic
oh ok. then what is the equivelent button for apt-get upgrade?
mark all upgrades and then apply
i understand that. but it wont let me mark that package
pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list
can i PM you
im not sure what you ment in that last message
pastebin your sources.list file first
where do i find that file
/etc/apt/
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/16281 source.list
you haven't enabled multiverse, just copy the sources.list ubotu is about to send you
